50% bias means that direction is selected from a half-circle facing the player
Make Dino always face the player
Keep roar positioned at the Dino's mouth
Disable the ship when it touches a dino
Manage roar
Roar is complete
Recover controls after the delay
Create treasure on 1% of the floor objects and only pick floor tiles that are touching a wall
Display how much treasure is left
Change color of glow of treasure
Record how much treasure was created
Delete treasure once it is picked up

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Add00, AlanPH, Tristan (Victris Games)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Expressions to convert RGB color values into various other colour formats (HSV, HSL, named colors) and vice versa.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ColorConversion
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Expressions to convert RGB color values into various other colour formats (HSV, HSL, named colors) and vice versa.

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a hexadecimal string into a RGB string.  Example input: "0459AF"
eventsFunctions.name: HexToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a hexadecimal string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHex

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSL string.  Example input: "0;128;255""
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsl

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSV color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), V(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HsvToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a RGB string into a HSV string.  Example input: "0;128;255"
eventsFunctions.name: RgbToHsv

eventsFunctions.description:
Converts a color name into a RGB string.  (Examples: black, gray, white, red, purple, green, yellow, blue)  
Full list of colors: https://www.w3schools.com/colors/colors_names.asp
eventsFunctions.name: NameToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts HSL color values into a RGB string.  Valid input ranges:  H(0 to 360), S(0 to 100), L(0 to 100)
eventsFunctions.name: HslToRgb

eventsFunctions.description: Converts a color hue (range: 0 to 360) into an RGB color string with 100% saturation and 50% lightness.
eventsFunctions.name: HueToRgb

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Gustavo Marciano
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.

Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: YSort
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create an illusion of depth by setting the Z-order based on the Y position of the object. Useful for isometric games, 2D games with a "Top-Down" view, RPG...

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Set the depth (Z-order) of the instance to the value of its Y position in the scene, creating an illusion of depth. The origin point of the object is used to determine the Z-order.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: YSort

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (@VictrisGames)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When this action is used, the object(s) will select a random nearby location and begin moving towards it (using the Pathfinding behavior).  If desired, choose a direction and how closely you want the object to follow it.  This can be used to make objects chase (or run away from) the player, or to make objects cross the screen using a meandering path.

Tips:
- To use this action on multiple instances at the same time, place it inside a ForEach() loop
- If you keep using this action, once the object reaches a destination, it will select a new random location and begin moving towards it.
- If you want to modify the speed of the object, edit the Pathfinding behavior of the object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Make object travel to random positions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make object travel to random positions (with the Pathfinding behavior).

eventsFunctions.description: Make object travel to a random position around the object current position. The movement is initiated only when the object is not moving already (its Pathfinding behavior speed is 0).  Move towards a specified angle, if desired.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Make object travel to a random position, with optional direction
eventsFunctions.name: TravelToRandomPositions
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM1_ to random positions, where each stop is at least _PARAM3_px and at most _PARAM4_px from the current position. Move towards angle _PARAM5_ with a bias of _PARAM6_.

events.comment: Only run when the object is not being moved by Pathfinding
Use default values if needed
Calculate the distance the object will travel
Calculate the maximum difference in degrees allowed from "Direction" based on "DirectionBias"
Select a random direction within the range
Select a direction based on the offset
Calculate position based on direction and distance
Create a new destination every time the object stops

parameters.description: Object that will be travelling (must have Pathfinding behavior)
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Direction (in degrees) the object will move towards (Range: 0-360)
parameters.name: Direction

parameters.longDescription: For example: "0" picks a completely random direction, "0.5" will select a direction within the half-circle that faces the specified direction, and "1" simply uses the specified direction.
parameters.name: DirectionBias

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy31, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Ideal for explosions, hit/impacts, earthquake, etc.

Select one or more methods of shaking:
- Position:  Shake the X and/or Y position of the camera 
- Angle: Shake the rotation of the camera 
- Zoom: Shake the zoom level of the camera 

Control how the camera shakes:
- Amplitude: How far the camera moves during each shake
- Duration: Amount of time to shake the camera
- Time between shakes: Amount of time between each change of the movement of the camera
- Keep shaking until stopped (boolean)

Tips:
- For a single-shake effect, set the "Time between shakes" to be equal to "Duration"  (great for a hit or impact)
- To make the single-shake move in the opposite direction, use negative numbers 
- To repeat a single-shake effect in a loop, add a condition "Camera is not shaking" 
- Use a long "Time between shakes" to simulate a slow moving object (like a ship rocking back and forth)
- Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters. 
- Use "Shake until stopped" to simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Shake the camera on the specified layer using one or more methods of shaking (position, angle, zoom)

eventsFunctions.description: Shake the camera on the specified layer, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, zoom)
eventsFunctions.name: CameraShake
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake camera on _PARAM3_ layer for _PARAM5_ seconds. Use an amplitude of _PARAM1_px on X axis and _PARAM2_px on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM6_ degrees, and zoom amplitude _PARAM7_ percent.  Wait _PARAM8_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM9_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the X axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of shaking on the Y axis (pixels) (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.longDescription: Duration value will be ignored
parameters.name: ShakeForever

events.comment: Keep shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
DisplacementAngle = ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate clockwise (this includes the initial shake and can be used for a one shake effect)
DisplacementAngle = -1 * ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude
Calculate Zoom shake
Calculate camera zoom displacement, with linear decay over time
ZoomDisplacement = ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase zoom
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ZoomDisplacement = -1 * ((DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration) * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change zoom
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Change angle
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Change zoom
Save the amount of change to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached or if stop shaking has been requested

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.description: Check if camera is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Stop shaking the camera
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Actions:
- Move camera when cursor touches screen edge
- Control zoom with mouse middle wheel
- Move camera position with middle button
- Rotate camera smoothly 
- Copy camera settings from one layer to another
- Limit the visible area seen by a camera

Requirements:
- Actions should be run every frame for correct functionality

eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allow user to control the camera using a keyboard and mouse

eventsFunctions.name: RotateCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Rotate camera on _PARAM1_ by _PARAM2_ (degrees) when _PARAM4_ is pressed. Rotation speed: _PARAM3_

Move camera towards target angle
Complete rotation when it gets close

parameters.longDescription: Use positive number for clockwise rotation and negetive number for counter-clockwise.

Detect movement on mouse wheel
Return the position of mouse when the zooming in

Restrict zoom so it stays within min and max values
Use lerp() to change zoom smoothly
Move camera position towards cursor location while zooming
Stop moving after a certain time

parameters.longDescription: Move camera towards cursor when zooming in.

eventsFunctions.description: Save camera positions on a layer and move to them when needed.

eventsFunctions.sentence: Save camera position of _PARAM1_ by pressing: "Ctrl+F5", "Ctrl+F6", "Ctrl+F7", or "Ctrl+F8". Move to a saved position by pressing the original key without "Ctrl".

events.comment: If using the zoom functions, use it for smooth transition
Otherwise just change zoom instantly

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is verified.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Checkbox can be toggled by a left-click or touch. 

When the checkbox is checked, the condition `Checked` is TRUE.
A halo appears when the mouse hovers near the checkbox.

Checkbox cannot be toggled by users if any of these are true:
- Checkbox is hidden
- Checkbox's layer is hidden
- Checkbox is disabled

Checkbox can always be changed by an action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Checkbox

events.comment: Fix inputs that create malformed checkboxes
Change shape painter based on properties
Draw checkbox
Set halo radius, if not specified
Detect hover
Change shape painter for halo
Detect touch/click
Draw halo
Draw left-side of checkmark
Draw right-side of checkmark

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
The `Value` expression will return the position of the slider on the bar, from 0 to 1, where 0 is the left-side, and 1 is the right-side.

You can [watch this tutorial](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs) showing how to use this extension - remember to attach it to a **Shape Painter** object.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use a shape-painter object to draw a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Use a shape-painter object to draw a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users. 

The `Value` expression will return the position of the slider on the bar, from 0 to 1, where 0 is the left-side, and 1 is the right-side.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

Prepare thumb settings

Draw halo when the mouse is hovering over thumb

events.inlineCode:
let stats = gdjs._GameStats
if(false && stats.labels.fps){ //try to reload stats if fps = infinity
    let fpsMeasures = stats.labels.fps
    fpsMeasures = Math.round(1000 / fpsMeasures[fpsMeasures.length-1])
    if(fpsMeasures > 100000) {
        Object.keys(stats.labels).forEach( o => stats.labels[o] = [])
        stats.currentTime = 0
        stats.prevTime = 0
        stats.previousAverageMS = 0
        stats.previousMaxMS = 0
        console.log("RELOAD STATS "+fpsMeasures)
    }
}
stats.begin()

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @oscuridad6661, Tristan Rhodes (@VictrisGames)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
How to use:
- Run the "Generate Dungeon Cave" or "Generate Dungeon with Rooms" action at the beginning of a scene.

Tips:
- Keep the amount of space used by room objects to less than ~25% of the total map.  If you add too many rooms, they will not be placed correctly and might collide with other rooms.
- Try using top-down controls combined with physics behavior (with no gravity) on the player and wall objects
- Use external layouts to place pre-designed rooms on randomly created room objects
- Use "Delete Unused Terrain" option to reduce resources used
- Use "RoomID(object)" expression to determine the starting and ending room
- Use "NeighborCount(object)" expression to find good places to place treasure.  A high amount of neighbors means that the tile is a nook or cranny.
- Use "IsRoomEntrance" condition to identify hallway objects that are adjacent to a room
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DungeonGenerator
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Create a procedurally generated dungeon.  Includes two layouts: "rooms and hallways" and "dungeon cave"

eventsFunctions.description: Set the size of hallway objects to be placed on the path created by the pathfinding object.
eventsFunctions.name: AdjustHallwaySizes
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the size of hallway objects _PARAM1_ to be placed on the path created by _PARAM2_ (Tile size: _PARAM4_ pixels, Hallway width: _PARAM5_ tiles)

events.comment: Set the default size of hallway object to the tilesize
Skip the first step in the path (so this function doesn't try to evaluate step 0)
Vertical move (previous frame)
Change in direction (this frame)
Horizontal move (previous frame)
Change in direction (this frame)

eventsFunctions.description: Fill world with terrain
eventsFunctions.name: FillWorld
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fill world with terrain (Tile size: _PARAM1_ pixels, Columns: _PARAM2_ tiles, Rows: _PARAM3_ tiles, Fill object: _PARAM4_)

events.name: Populate map with terrain objects everywhere

eventsFunctions.description: Generate a dungeon cave using a random walk algorithm.  When the walker touches an edge of the map, it is moved back to the center of map.
eventsFunctions.name: GenerateDungeonCave
eventsFunctions.sentence: Generate a dungeon cave that has _PARAM8_ percent floor objects (Tile size: _PARAM1_ pixels, Map width: _PARAM2_ tiles, Map height: _PARAM3_ tiles, Terrain object: _PARAM4_, Floor object: _PARAM5_, Wall object: _PARAM12_, Walker object: _PARAM7_, Walker width/height: _PARAM9_ tiles, Minimum border: _PARAM10_ tiles, Create objects on layer: _PARAM6_, Delete unused terrain: _PARAM11_, Calculate neighbors: _PARAM13_)

events.comment: Calculate the number of floor objects to be created.  Don't include border in calculation.  Multiply border by 2 because it needs to exist on both sides (top+bottom, left+right).
Initialize counters
Start with an empty map (array)
Initialize walker offsets (these are used to make the walker take up more than one tile)
Create (WalkerSize^2) quantity of objects (1x1=1, 2x2=4, 3x3=9, etc0

Create virtual walker objects. Walker objects are ONLY used to store variables and to perform ForEach() loops.  Position, size, and appearance DO NOT matter.  
TODO: These could be replaced by structure variables.
Calculate the starting position (in the 2D array) and save it so it can be used for restarts
Reset variables
Calculate chance to go in each direction based on the ratio of width to height
Generate a random number between 0 and 1
Move LEFT
Move RIGHT
Move UP
Move DOWN
If ANY Walker is outside map boundries, reset ALL of them to their starting positions
Check all Walkers if they are on top of terrain
Move back to starting position
If Walker is on Terrain, delete it
Track how many steps were taken
Loop through every tile in the map
Create terrain objects when array value is 0
Create floor objects when array value is 1
Add walls
Create walls where terrain touches floor
Delete walkers
Delete unused terrain (if desired)

parameters.longDescription: All objects are based on this size
parameters.name: TileSize

parameters.longDescription: Terrain object is used to fill the map that is not covered by floors, hallways, or walls.
parameters.name: TerrainObject

parameters.longDescription: Floor objects are created on every tile that a walker has travelled to.
parameters.name: FloorObject

parameters.longDescription: Use a random walk algorithm to turn terrain objects into floor objects
parameters.name: WalkerObject

parameters.longDescription: Percentage of map that will be convered by floor objects
parameters.name: FloorPercentage

parameters.longDescription: The number of tiles for each side of the square walker object.  For example, 2=2x2, 3=3x3, 4=4x4.
parameters.name: WalkerSize

parameters.longDescription: Can be used to provide a border of terrain around the map
parameters.name: MinBorder

parameters.longDescription: Wall objects are placed between floor and terrain objects.
parameters.name: WallObject

parameters.longDescription: May take a few seconds to calculate neighbors on a large map, so disable this if you are not using it.
parameters.name: CalculateNeighbors

eventsFunctions.description: Generate a dungeon by placing rooms in random locations and moving them if they collide with each other.  Rooms are connected with hallways.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Generate a dungeon with room and hallways
eventsFunctions.name: GenerateDungeonRooms
eventsFunctions.sentence: Generate a dungeon with rooms (Room Qty: _PARAM7_, Tile size: _PARAM1_ pixels, Map width: _PARAM2_ tiles, Map height: _PARAM3_ tiles, Terrain object: _PARAM4_, Room object: _PARAM5_, Wall object: _PARAM20_, Hallway object: _PARAM6_, Pathfinding object: _PARAM13_, Min room width: _PARAM9_ tiles, Max room width: _PARAM10_ tiles, Min room height: _PARAM11_ tiles, Max room height: _PARAM12_ tiles, Hallway width: _PARAM17_ tiles, Create objects on layer: _PARAM8_, Max separation attempts: _PARAM15_, Connect rooms in a loop: _PARAM16_, Additional paths: _PARAM18_, Delete unused terrain: _PARAM19_)

events.name: Populate map with terrain objects everywhere

events.comment: Create a new room in a random location on map
Change the room to a random size
Estimate starting distance between rooms
Set a default value for separation attempts
If rooms are close to each other, move them to a new random location
Move in a random direction the distance of a room
Move object back into the usable part of map
Create pathfinder object if one doesn't exist
Make sure pathfinding cell size matches tile size
Move the pathfinder object to a random starting room
Reset counter (used to assign RoomID to rooms)
Cycle through all rooms, always going to the nearest unvisited room
Assign path order if one does not exist
Set the destination of the pathfinder to the next room
Create a hallway object at every cell along the path to the destination
Adjust size of hallway objects
Move the pathfinder object to the room that was just connected with a hallway
If desired, connect a hallway from the last room to the first room
Set the destination of the pathfinder to the starting room
Create a hallway object at every cell along the path to the destination
Adjust size of hallway objects
Move the pathfinder object to the room that was just connected with a hallway
If desired, make additional random connections between rooms
Set the destination of the pathfinder to the next room (don't select the room that already has the pathfinder)
Create a hallway object at every cell along the path to the destination
Adjust size of hallway objects
Move the pathfinder object to the room that was just connected with a hallway

events.name: Remove terrain from rooms and hallways.

events.comment: Remove terrain from inside rooms and hallways.
Create walls where terrain touches hallways but not rooms
Create walls where terrain touches rooms but not hallways
Delete hallways that are at least partially inside of rooms
Set boolean flag for hallways that are doorways (adjacent to room but not touching)
Remove extra terrain, if needed
Cleanup pathfinder object

parameters.longDescription: All objects are based on this size
parameters.name: TileSize

parameters.longDescription: Used to fill the map that is not covered by floors, hallways, or walls.
parameters.name: TerrainObject

parameters.longDescription: Rooms are placed in random locations and will try to not overlap with other rooms.
parameters.name: RoomObject

parameters.longDescription: Used to connect room objects.  They follow the path made by the pathfinder object.
parameters.name: HallwayObject

parameters.longDescription: Rooms should take less than ~25% of map to ensure non-overlapping rooms.  If there are too many rooms, they may end up overlapping each other.
parameters.name: RoomQty

parameters.longDescription: Used to identify where hallways are placed between rooms
parameters.name: PathfinderObject

parameters.longDescription: Number of attempts to separate overalapping rooms.  When this number is reached, rooms are left in current position. (Default: 10,000)
parameters.name: MaxSeparationAttempts

eventsFunctions.description: Calculate the number of grid neighbors around an object.  Use "NeighborCount(Object)" expression to retrieve this value.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Calculate the number of grid neighbors around an object
eventsFunctions.name: CalculateGridNeighbors
eventsFunctions.sentence: Calculate the number of grid neighbors (_PARAM2_) around object (_PARAM1_)

events.comment: Save center point and size as scene variables (since we can't compare instances of the same object)
Initiate offset to start looking for the top-left neighbor
Search for neighbors (but don't consider the center object)
Save neighbor count in real object

eventsFunctions.description: The numerical order this room was created.  (Range: 1 to total number of rooms)
eventsFunctions.name: RoomID

eventsFunctions.description: Number of grid neighbors of an object.  Requires running the "CalculateGridNeighbors" action before using this expression.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Number of grid neighbors of an object
eventsFunctions.name: NeighborCount

eventsFunctions.description: Check if hallway is a room entrance
eventsFunctions.name: IsRoomEntrance
